data.text:
BillboardEditorHannah KarpFormer editorsLee Zhito, Tony Gervino, Bill Werde, Tamara ConniffCategoriesEntertainmentFrequencyWeeklyPublisherLynne SegallTotal circulation17,000 magazines per week

15.2 million unique visitors per month[1]Founder

William Donaldson

James Hennegan

Year foundedNovember 1, 1894; 129 years ago ( ) (as Billboard Advertising)CountryUnited StatesBased inNew York CityLanguageEnglishWebsitewww .billboard .com ISSN0006-2510

Billboard is an international American music and entertainment magazine. It s most famous for the Billboard charts, which lists the top albums and singles of the week.

The magazine was started on November 1, 1894 in Cincinnati, Ohio by William H. Donaldson and James Hennegan. It was originally called Billboard Advertising.
